title: Ticket #4154: Improve expression building in python
description:
Expression building in python, even after #3900, is still quite unsatisfactory.

We should be able to do the following: 

foo = "bar"
expr = classad.Attribute("MyType") == classad.Literal(foo)

to create the expression MyType == "bar". This allows more careful expression building (such as and-ing together multiple expressions to form a requirements); the prior ticket only helped with string literals. We should expose the following functionality:

  • As many operators as natively possible in python (multiply / divide / add / subtract / bitwise ops / comparison ops,
  • Provide functions for operators that are not possible to override / don't exist in python (such as the logical and, logical or, is, and isnt),
  • "sameAs" for expression comparison,
  • Match classads,
  • and "flatten" for partial evaluation.
